content: mountain ash socks designed by shuyi wu notes i wanted to design something to showcase a lovely skein of dark green sock yarn not too boring and not too tedious i thoroughly enjoyed knitting this pattern and i hope you will too instructions are provided for two sizes s m with 64 72 stitches per round the pattern will incorporate increases and decreases to account for cables so pick your usual stitch count most of the pattern is charted only you may use any technique you prefer for knitting a tube in the round supplies 100g of solid-coloured sock yarn fingering weight wool/nylon mix 2 5mm us1 5 needles or size needed to obtain gauge cable needle if you need one locking stitch markers yarn needle abbreviations general st s = stitch es bor = beginning of round rs = right side ws = wrong side cn = cable needle basic stitches k = knit p = purl sl = slip purlwise with yarn to ws ktbl = knit through the back loop increases and yo = yarn over decreases p2tog = purl 2 together k2tog = knit 2 together ssk = slip 2 sts knitwise separately knit slipped sts together through back loops k3tog = knit 3 together sssk = slip 3 sts knitwise separately knit slipped sts together through back loops sk2p = slip 1 st knitwise knit 2 together pass slipped st over kyok = knit without removing old st from needle yarn over knit into same st again mountain ash socks v1 0 - shuyi wu - 1 pkyok = pass third st on left needle over first 2 sts knit first st yarn over knit second st note that this consumes 3 sts and produces 3 sts and is technically not an increase or a decrease cables x/y lc or lpc = left cross with x knit sts moving over y knit or purl sts slip x sts to cn and hold in front knit or purl y sts knit x sts from cn x/y rc or rpc = right cross with x knit sts moving over y knit or purl sts slip y sts to cn and hold in back knit x sts knit or purl y sts from cn 1/1 lpt = left purl twist slip 1 st to cn and hold in front p1 k1tbl from cn 1/1 repeat = right purl twist slip 1 st to cn and hold in back k1tbl p1 from cn 2/2 lpc alternate = slip 2 sts to cn and hold in front k1tbl p1 from left needle then k2 from cn 2/2 rpc alternate = slip 2 sts to cn and hold in back k2 from left needle then p1 k1tbl from cn gauge 8 stitches and 11 row = 1 inch / 2 5 cm in stockinette mountain ash socks v1 0 - shuyi wu - 2 clue 1 we will start off with the cuff and part of the leg using a stretchy
